column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I liked it better when you were able to pause slideshows because half the time, I don't want to hear the audio. Also, I can't use tiktok for more than twenty minutes because then the videos stop loading and I can't watch them for over an hour. It's apparently an issue with my WiFi being slow, but if I have my WiFi and data on it still doesn't load. My WiFi works perfectly, so I think it's a problem with the app.

And before you say it, yes, I've gone back and all these videos still exist days/weeks/months after my problem, including the accounts. So in short, it's starting to get worse.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Going back in & finding all your vids have been muted. Copyright changes. Fine. Fixed the issue. Now videos that I just created have ALSO been muted. Videos that I've fixed the sound on have been remuted, my ORIGINAL audio - as in our voices - are missing, OR replacing sounds with the exact same song that has been muted?!?! An absolute waste of users time. So what exactly is the point of this app any more??

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: This is the best app on the Internet. So easy to install you can't possibly make a mistake setting it up, even for the simple minded. You can search for the type of video you would like to see and the algorithm locates videos based on what you have watched, liked and commented on - so like and comment only the type of video you want to see more of. You can download videos you would like to keep. Also you can change any setting under profile. Oh, TikTok collects less data than Google or amazon

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a very great app with videos and music, I really enjoy. But as an android user, i think it's very dumb about the fact that there is no dark mode option. What's the point of giving iOS dark mode but not android? Some android users can go to the settings app and force it by turning on a third-person app display, but some android phones, including mine, can't do that either. I think there's no point in giving IOS dark mode and not android, please, and thank you so much!

Overall, I have no problem with the app, just that the fact that most soundtracks are gone.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Very addicting, easy to use, rich in preference settings. The only thing I have a problem with is the organization of comment replies, everything is jumbled up and people miss corrections (due to the inability to edit comments) because it's mixed in with all the other replies. I would suggest a cleaner way to organize replies and comments, possibly a thread like structure for replies under replies. In order to avoid the comment section looking like a program script, I would also add collapsing.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Firstly, it would be great to have a modern trending page within the 'songs' section, showcasing the top trending songs of the day. Additionally, it would be beneficial to include regional soundtracks by official artists to avoid the upload of copyrighted material. Lastly, users should be able to use 15-second clips of any sound within their TikTok videos, similar to how Instagram Reels allow for longer clip

This might not be so good if you want to see different things and explore new content.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Hallo TikTok If your TikTok ID isn't garnering the views you expected, there are a few strategies you can employ to increase visibility. Firstly, ensure your content is engaging, unique, and relevant to your audience. Experiment with trending hashtags, catchy captions, and eye-catching thumbnails to attract attention. Consistency is key, so try to post regularly to keep your audience engaged. Additionally, engage with other users by commenting, liking, and sharing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: UPDATE: They have a carbon copy of the AliExpress app within the TikTok app called "The TikTok Shop." It not only looks exactly like AliExpress, but uses the same code that steals device data. That data gets sent to the Triads (owners of AliExpress), and sold on the dark web. They sell the exact same counterfeit products from AliExpress on TikTok as well. This is deeply troubling for those who know about technology, and have a background in cyber security.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: TikTok downloads videos into the DCIM camera folder - the same folder that the default Camera app saves your own photos/videos in. It's an absurd choice by TikTok to store downloaded videos in your camera folder. And since I have Google Photos automatically back up all my Camera photos/videos, it ends up backing up TikTok videos as well. TikTok doesn't allow changing its default folder to save downloaded files.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Overall, TikTok provides a unique and entertaining user experience, but users should be mindful of privacy settings and content moderation.

column3: Despite being one of the most used global social media platforms, some of the policies of this app is lamentable. The unjust censorship of the pro-palestine content is a deplorable example of this. Social media is supposed to be a place where people can express their individual thoughts and beliefs freely. Regrettably it is not used as for its original purpose. I hope that this issue is fixed urgently so that everyone can express themselves freely as before.

It would be nice if we could have a switch for subtitles. Other than the subtitles everything is great to me! This app brightens my day! Keep it up tiktok!💕

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Close to perfect, as a regular viewer it's perfect, of you want videos and a good background algorithm that gives you the content you want, this is the app for you. As a content creator, I feel that there is a learning curve for usage of the app that should really have some kind of inbuilt manual for ease of use. Also, certain features seem to be missing on the android version, such as being able to post video-comments.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The songs are nice, but all sound like a broken record. For those old enough to remember the old lp records, sounds like a bad scratch. For those who are young, a pause with words missing. I was only looking for a ringtone of a particular song, not a lot of personal videos, so this is of no use to me with the song being chopped to pieces.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: PHOTOSENSITIVE PEOPLE: RUN Worst social media I've tried. The app itself is designed to overstimulate, confuse, and exploit. Despite how obvious this is, many artists need to be on it to keep up with engagement. It's gotten to the point that I finally tried it again, only to find that a current trend is flickering light videos that are literally painful for me to look at. I tried muting this trend, which appears to have no effect at all. Another one came up within minutes.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This a platform for all to show ur hidden talent. I like it. But some features should be changed. 1. video play one after another automatically 2. video should be arranged according to no. of likes. Always highest likes video in the first place. 3. ur unseen video should appear in first . After that seen video start. u can go direct to the list of seen video with the help of other button.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Generally, a well thought out app. With plenty of predecessors' fails to structure itself from. Lots of ads, tho, and the algorithm for your personalized viewing experience is a bit too quick on the uptake sometimes. However, the adds are easily skipped and more on the side of fairly entertaining than most similar apps. Also, seems pretty free-speech oriented. Which is always great to see.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm giving tiktok a 4 stars because it is literally the only app I use all day every day and it is super reliable. it has basically changed my life. one thing though, I have updated it as much as there is to update, and I still cannot do the photo swipe feature. it just comes up with a video and I want it to make it so ypu can swipe through photos. I see other people doing tutorials and I don't have any of the features they do. I also don't have story mode anymore. I only have camera. pls fix it

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I am going to give you a three. Everyone has the "Text-To-Speech" except for me. Before you think it's the one that says your own text for you, it isn't that. It's the overlapping speech voice. I have not a clue why this is happening, but I suggest you get it fixed. Also all the updates get to IOS phones before Android which is phoneist. Otherwise your app is magnificent! Thank you.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I've liked it a lot so far, but I got some weird audio syncing issues with one of the videos I was editing. Like I recorded something and the audio was delayed by at LEAST 3 seconds. I thought "No problem! I'll just cut the clip and reshoot it." But when I cut the clip, it cut the audio for the ENTIRE video. It was frustrating because now that tiktok is in Limbo because there's no way to troubleshoot IN the app. I wish it let us edit a bit more than the options you already have. Contact me Dev!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The algorithm was once so beautiful..... Now not so much. My fyp is now just 4 types of videos: clips of movies or shows split screen with gameplay, artists promoting their music/craft, meandering storytimes complaining about something, or standup comedy clips (also being promoted). The only reason I see anything enjoyable is that I built a good 'following' page in the before times.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Short cute videos, plenty of adorable animals, and some interesting facts and people. Some of them do get repetitive like the cliche girl with waist length hair in booty shorts doing the same dance everyone else is doing. WAYYYY too many trends. That's why I'm glad there's a "for you" page so it just shows you stuff similar to what you like instead of just showing you everything.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to be great with a lot of really interesting high quality videos showing all kinds of art, talents, travel & more. Now it's full of people posting blurry, bad & banal "story times", facts & repetitive copycats. Definitely disappointed with the lack of originality, effort & experience. Do not waste your time unless you truly want to walk away with worse than nothing: boredom!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I would love to see more anime-type effects on there for superheroes, Dragon Ball Anime, etc. It's a great app. Also, the ability to change whether or not you have the TikTok logo on there floating around your videos would be great. You can leave the ending part alone. Besides that, it's a great app. Oh, one more thing. Bring back the ability to speed up or slow down the music.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is amazing , however I did have some glitches happen while using the app . For example , when you press the button to record a video with a sound , the sound plays while the camera is just stuck in a position , and no , on the camera app this has never happend . This glitch has been occurring for about 1 month and a half . Sometimes it works but not often . I hardly ever record videos anyways , but I do however post edits , and it works just fine , so it doesn't really bother me that

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: For the past three days... I got logged out of my former account, I couldn't get it back and I opened a new one. Now I get logged out everytime and I can't follow more than 16 people,my fyp is disorganized everytime. The whole app is very buggy for real and it's getting annoying. I can't save videos, I can't share, I send or receive messages and videos. It's becoming really annoying. Worst of all, the search bar is always telling me "no internet connection". There are just so many bugs. Pleasee.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: [EDITED REVIEW] so, I got this a while back, and at first I loved it, but now that I've had time to have it, there are a few things I wanna point out. It tends to take up a lot of space, and glitch out from time to time. I can't scroll two videos without an ad, and they continuously "update" it, in which they'll take away ALL features, before giving them back, with MAYBE one or two adjustments. In all, it's an okay app, and fun, but beware of the ads and glitches. 💪✌️

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app itself is wonderful, but this newest update made it so that when coming across a slideshow (photo mode) and you pause it, it causes the comments to scroll up. I preferred it the way they had it before (when you paused it, you could still look through the photos but not hear the sound and without the bio and comments taking up the screen.)

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: A little difficult to get the hang of if you want to make videos, but this app makes for an extremely good time sink. I just wish that they'd manufacture a solution to the audio lag that happens when you record a duet w someone while wearing bluetooth earbuds. It makes magical musical duets really difficult, especially with a phone that doesn't have an aux port to plug wired headphones into to help remove the lag.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: NO ADS! I never wanted to use TiKToK and always watched on Facebook. The ads on Facebook have become so bad, I decided to get the TT app. The only add I encounter is when I first open it and I can skip right away, or the occasional ad video that I can CHOOSE to scroll on by whenever if I so choose. I know the average American can be easily manipulated but if I see an ad and it MAKES me watch it, I can guarantee I will never use or buy that product. Either way, don't EVER change.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is amazing. The the two refresh buttons are really annoying. I can't tell you how many amazing video's I have skipped because I accidentally pressed one of the refresh buttons. Also, why is there no auto-scroll option? Sometimes I just want to watch tiktoks hands-free (when it's cold, while eating) but i can't because I have to scroll every few seconds, please fix that.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Tiktok used to work pretty well for me. But, I'm suddenly having all kinds of issues. The "not interested", "hide videos by this user", and "hide videos with this sound" buttons no longer work. The same videos will continue to show up over and over, forcing me to block to user in order to stop seeing their content. In general, the app is becoming very buggy. Audio no longer syncs with videos, it has trouble loading comments, etc. It's incredibly frustrating

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Not bad theres a lot of ads and it wont let me open the app! Its telling me to update it which i did but it still wont work🙄 but i do like the rest. So tiktok, fix it!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Its a great app, i am literally addicited. Although i would say it requires a few more updates. Like having and option to see every one that duets a video. And being able to put your favorites in different folders to find videos easier. Also it should have an option like "are you sure you want to refresh?" Because i always refresh by accident and lose the video i was watching.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is pretty good nothing wrong with it, but I still have many features and updates that didn't show but my friends features came in early.please fix this and add new features. I sent multiple requests and emails and never replied. user is monsterzzz just add the features. Everything nothing new just like the slideshow and full screen and auto scroll I don't have any of them.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Unresponsive, won't pause. It let me pause one video, otherwise it just wouldn't respond while a video is playing. Then it jumps to another annoying video while I'm still trying to pause the first one. I'm not a boomer, just an impatient millennial, but I like to have more control over my media. Maybe I'll try again later to see if it's better.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm digging the favorites menu, but I'd love for it to be a playlist situation, i.e. you can select to make it private, friends only, or public, so people can see what you're adding to each playlist, and it would be cool if I could add a video to more than one favorite folder. It also makes very little sense that you can only message people if they follow you and you follow them, just give us a chance to reject or accept the message like messenger does instead pls??

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I like the app in general. But there are 2 main things that bug me the most. The ads are very annoying, although I already got used to deal with ads on social media over the years, Tik Tok doesn't really seem to recognize my preferences, so when it shows me ads with ppl dancing or whatever, it's very annoying. And the other thing that I don't like is that they go through my contacts and messaging other ppl through the app is not private, meaning that they can see the messages I send my friends.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The app isn't bad, I enjoy using the audios for edits and cosplay but really when it comes to the management aspect it's difficult. Accidently posted a draft? Rip put it on private and reshoot, you've lost it. Typo in the caption? You can't edit it, just repost it. Need support? Non existent, well appeal taken down videos but we won't put them back up There's a lot of things that need to be fixed before this app can truly be what it's capable of being but honestly I'm not too hopeful 2 ☆

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'll give you 5star when you give us the Search🔍 for music function. I'm wasting a lot of time by scrolling up and down when browsing music to attach on the video from my phone. Instead of just typing the name of the song. The search function is only available when you adding music from online and it's not available when you adding music from the local storage. Thx

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: i enjoy this app and the people on it; however, there are some faults. after scrolling for a while, there is a glitch where the whole screen turns white so i have to close the app and open it again to restore it. the messaging function is also very bad. i wish i could delete messages, send pictures, and see if the person i sent messages to has seen them via read receipts. it would be very nice if you would fix these. thank you.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: This app like so many others tries it's best to allow for short media content creation and viewing. It excels honestly in both regards to other comparable apps. The UI for content creation is smooth and easy to learn while allowing for complexity. While the viewing send to be widely dispersed and highly discoverable. The reason I give 4 starts is because I think there is more that can be improved upon although being far ahead.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's OK but I don't like that they took my slide option away.and they suspended my account for no reason and won't let me know why. this is a huge let down.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Ever since the most recent update, I've been having trouble with duets. Either the audio of the video I'm dueting is completely out of sync or it starts out normal but, when I press the record button again, there is a slight delay. I've tried everything. I've tried restarting my device, uninstalling the app and then reinstalling it, and updating, none of which has worked. I reported it to the help center but they haven't even gotten back to me.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Hi tiktok. I'm so frustrated with this buggy app. Not sure if it's just me but for a while now I've been experiencing repetitive bugs such as mentions in comments not going through to the user, notifications not going through to me, and my friend being unable to follow me meaning I am unable to send videos to them. It is unfortunate that this glitch is happening and honestly I request this to be fixed at once. I've deleted the app multiple times, force stopped it and yet nothing has fixed it.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I love the app. Although there are problems that are frustrating. In July, I switched from an IPhone 8+ to a Samsung s20. Even with the older version IPhone, it still has more options than my newer Samsung. The duets don't have a mic option for me to use my own sound because its said they pick and choose who they send thag out too, and some of the filters don't work correctly. I've messaged and i hope to get some answers. Also, I've already reported a problem twice about a week ago.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: I get to laughfs out and learn from the app, very nice to have the experience then, I can share the videos if I like the video enough and share with people that take similar interests, thank you tic tok.I love this app. so much and recommend it to all.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: TikTok is actually a pretty good app, I like to use it for motivation and ideas. However, there should be an option to turn off lives showing up on your for you page. Also, it won't let me delete or change the names of my favorited collections. Other people have also been saying that they can't even use the collection feature. I also keep getting kicked off the app and it won't let me back in unless I restart my phone.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I really like TikTok!! It's editing features are top notch, and I like how easy it is just to open the app and use it! Though there is only one problem: It takes lots of data and it downloads slow. It was at sixteen percent and the next minute, it stays at 88%. Overall, the app is still enjoyable and fun. I look forward to the new updates.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is great for watching really entertaining videos with it's visually appealing and easy to understand interface. However, this afternoon I was disturbed to find out that it had used up 1.47 GB of mobile data (3/4 of my total available data) in less than a month, just in the background - not even while I was using the app. I have since disabled it's ability to do that but the fact that it is using so much data while the app is closed is frankly disturbing.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It can be a fun app once you get past all the stupid stuff you don't want to see. But my main problem is the entire app is based on using audios that are provided and yet when you attach the audio to give them credit it doesn't allow it (it removes it) in a recent update. Then my video I worked hard on is processing for hours. Sometimes never to be posted. I put the credit in the comments too and it won't allow you to pin comments. PLEASE bring back pinned comments. Thanks so much. 🙏🏻

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's my new addiction.... I like it and there are people on there I have met that are just amazing. It does take up alot of space on my phone though. It is more of my phone issue over the app issue there though. I also dont have duet layouts and I am not entirely sure why. I would like to be able to search through my likes videos with a search bar, cause it's sometimes hard to find a specific video I was talking about and that would narrow it a bit. But other then that I really enjoy the app.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have issueS that prevent me from using the app for its intended purpose. I have attempted to submit a complaint MULTIPLE times, but every time I hit submit, it says I have no network connection. So now I have completely failed at everything TikTok, and have nowhere to go but here. I have a newer phone and reliable WiFi. I have photos of my complaints (including WiFi and cellular at working) and nowhere to send them. 2 stars is very generous at this point.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: I never ever use this type of a brilliant social network application in my life... It was a awesome app you launched, real great👍🏻 thanking you for asking me my rewiew🙏

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is most intertaining and so many interesting . also aknowledging in short videos .

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Sucked. The app wouldn't stay on for more than 2 seconds, then crashed to the home screen. Eventually, on my third try, it crashed my phone completely and I had to restart it. It seems you need to have a really nice fancy phone for it to actually work, as some of the other people describing my problem also have low quality, cheaper phones.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: The only thing bad so far. The app will delete a video you were half way though finishing, while working on it. No idea if it's a bug or my phone. But it gets irritating sometimes. Notice it happens less with better phones. Still fun, still a great place to post interesting things. Could do with less social media in my life, but so can everyone. Best of luck to people working on this app.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Fantastic app! It helps so many people to out content, it's very easy to make a nice video. There is so much content on everything and anything it's amazing! The only two things that stop me to put a 5 ⭐: _ If a video is longer than the maximum length and it's in multiple parts, you waste so much time scrolling through the user upload to find the next part! Annoying, it should take you straight to the video you watched in their profile. _ The "tik tok trap" spend hours on it...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Audio bleeds over from one video to the next. There is almost always a error message in the middle of the screen that says "sorry, this video isn't available" even though the video is playing. The clear mode is not nearly as smooth as the previous version. On the older version if you selected it on the video you were watching you would instantly get the clear mode on it. It doesn't happen on this latest version. The next video will be clear and the clear mode stays on. Not happy with this.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Tiktok really needs to learn how to make filters available to all devices. If it can download it, it could be able to have all access. Also, when I make a video now, the end of the audio is cut off or can't be recorded if I try to make a cut there, and the sound when recording is always slowed and pitched down. I have a samsung S10. Pretty new, pretty good. There's no reason this should be happening. The social aspect if this is great, but the creator aspect of this is terrible......

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: pretty good app. the algorithm could be better, i sometimes get suggested videos that are no where near what kind of content i usually interact with. pretty simple to use. very addicting, and that can make it difficult to stop watching/making videos. also, the app is much worse for androids, for example camera quality. overall, i enjoy tiktok besides the negatives i talked about.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using this app alot until I discovered that the app opened on its own. Whenever I go to sleep i remove every app from the phone tab. When I woke up I used to see tiktok opened. I think this app is spying on people. Another thing is that when swiping up to see the opened apps, tiktok wasn't there. Why? Maybe because they don't want you to see that it opens by itself, without you clicking it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Takes forever to load and watching live feeds are always a problem because they freeze too much! Every time that I make a comment on a live the app freezes. It won't let me tap and like the video without kicking me out of the room! I'm trying to watch a live show now and it just keeps buffering. It buffers way too much and for too long!!! IT'S IRRITATING!!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I had an email that said I had 3 new contacts, tik tok made me download the app just to find out that I did not have any notifications or contacts. This app is for useless people. I immediately Uninstaller the app because Google already knows everything and tik tok is for 5 year Olds who only care about themselves.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I would have given it even less than 1 star. in fact for you there should be a negative rating system. in beginning I was liking it, but then. I used the inbuilt messaging software to communicate with my friends. and that has a lot of bugs, why dont you fix them! it has some keywords if those words are there in the text then the text does not appear on the friends screen. and the messages are received after so long. that messaging experience ruined the whole fun of using this app!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's the TikToks! Massive short attention theater at scale. Consumption is great of that's all you're here for, but for creators editing capabilities are clumsy and limiting. They've improved but still it would be nice if you could recut to music better being able to split like video, importing 1080+ clip would be awesome, basics like cropping and resizing, speed ramping (yes you can slow mo). Overall I tend to edit outside the app due to all the limitations which is frustrating.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Tik Tok is a fantastic app for a lot of things. Unfortunately there are a lot of people that try to cause problems with it especially racist individuals and the United States government. But whatever app they make after this we will definitely look forward to using, it's an app that definitely helps an individual have a voice whether it's a good voice or bad voice is to be determined.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Nvidia Shield doesn't allow for any type of video engagement. No ability to move the video forward, or backwards. No ability for comments (which should be possible with a Bluetooth keyboard, as the Nvidia Shield does work with Bluetooth accessories). Also the audio/video becoming unsynchronized is incredibly annoying. Mostly just disappointed that I can't rewind for fast forward for the bits of video that are difficult to hear, or contain information I'd like to write down (like book titles).

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Can't access my inbox from Chromebook, which is why I installed it. Not only is it missing that feature, but this build of the app is actually LESS functional than the existing web interface. What's even the point? Literally only two buttons: home and discover. I can't even upload like I can from web. Also it crashes every time I try playing a video. Response: if I could keep the app running for longer than three seconds before it starts autoplaying a video and crashes, I might be able to. :P

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is very entertaining. Sometimes there may be some inapropriete content for certain ages. I've also recently had a problem while scrolling through tiktok a video freezes and the previous audio plays but I just swipe up and down then a couple minutes later it happens again I'm not sure what the reason is since everything has been just fine until this point.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It's not very easy to find the popular audio in order to use it, you can only find music when searching in the "sounds" unless you know the name of the exact audio you need (all the voiceovers, for example) Then there's the matter of the caption/hashtag/profile button/comment button/share button all sitting on top of the video. They can't be hidden which makes videos with text inside them really inconvenient to watch because you're trying to be able to read the words through obstructions.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The only small improvement I can really think of is when I swipe over or click on a tiktoker's profile to watch more of their videos (cause they're in parts usually put together in order to make up one huge clip), I think it would be cool if you could find a way to give an option to go to that specific video. Like if swiping left takes me to that video on their page, but clicking their profile button takes me to their main page.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: the algorithm used to be very accurate, but after the last few updates the "Not Interested" mechanic doesn't seem to work anymore, and you can only block up to 100 video tags that barely exclude anything that you can't ignore. This has left me with having to block hundreds of profiles in their entirety in order to avoid unwanted content, and even that doesn't help much. 1/30/23 - "Not Interested" and "Hide videos with this sound" still not working. no point in having these options

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Really fun! I really enjoy making videos even though I'm not that cool XD but either way it's great but I've switched phones a couple times (old family phones.) And I get switched abilities. Like on my old Android I couldn't go live. Now I can. And I couldn't use the green screen filter thing on my old Android (same as before) and now it works fine. I think it depends on model and size though. Anyways, amazing app! 😁

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Can you please give your users the option to remove or turn off the double "tap again to exit" feature. I like this platform a lot, but I don't like that it makes me feel trapped. I never accidentally close the app, if that is what you're "trying" to insinuate with this feature. When I want to close the app, I actually want to close the app. I don't think it's healthy for kids, which most of your consumers are, if I (a 28y old) keep getting sucked back in to scrolling into the abyss. Thank you.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It's nice for the entertainment value. But, it is a massive resource hog! Watching shorts, etc., is okay-ish. However, watching lives will drain the battery very quickly. Upon installing it, make sure to remove all permissions, alerts, notifications, and disable background data unless you want to have loud alerts play even when the phone is silenced as well as eating up your data plan!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You cannot discuss neurodivergence without having videos suppressed or muted. The app tracks the info you input into your phone on other apps (which it states in its privacy policy) for advertising, and moderation is nearly non-existent. There are many great creators with excellent ideas and unique voices, but it often feels like you need to actively fight to find them because content is shown to you strictly algorithmically. While useful, it is exhausting and invasive.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I like the app in general, but recently after using the feature once, the Connect LIVE to PC/Mac option has disappeared from my list of live streaming options. I can't seem to find any resolutions online and I've already submitted two reports that haven't received any response. I can't even find a way to re-apply for the feature. My rating will sit at 3 stars until this issue is resolved.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Great app. Only thing that bugs me is when i use my own audio, like talking in a video, the sound is really low, its not my phone because every other video app is fine and have normal levels of audio. For some reason its at a low level. That needs to be fixed. Or there must be a solution im not aware of that raises the audio to my videos when i speak.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Don't bother trying to contact support. They won't answer at all. Two things I really hate about this app without getting a chance to even try other features: 1 videos auto play (at max volume). I'd rather have the option to decide whether I want to hear the video or not. 2 I was told my username was taken. Yet when I searched for the user who had it not a single profile came up. It's a unique name that's never been taken on any other social media site.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I really like this app but there are really annoying things as a non iphone user. First of all, my camera quality it's really good but in the moment I open TikTok it seems like I'm using a 2006 phone. Second, most of the filters are not available? Like simple filters as "date" or "brown hair" or "blue eyes". I'm 100% sure my phone can support that type of filters but I still can't use them. These two problems really ruin the experience. Please do something.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Great platform. Amazing algorithm and great user data protection. Easy to use and configure. Very few ads, and the ones I do see are relevant. I use TT to learn about all sorts of things...home repairs, exercises, health tips. And of course it's entertaining in other ways without being irritating or one dimensional. The mix of posts is just right, and I like that I can consume vids without creating them.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Tiktok provides a great experience, with an algorithm that tailors to what you want to see. You'll find some of the most unbiased information possible, and delivered in easy to digest bits. The only thing I find lacking is some of the features and settings are locked behind device model and/or region. On the plus side, at least they don't steal your info like *some* companies...

I wish it would just go back to normal. I have a lot of friends overseas and we communicate only via messenger.

I'm so really done with this app. And the worst thing is that I was really getting the hang of and making somewhat decent content, then you freaking delete it.😤😠

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

The newest trend always attaches to a specific sound, on my page every other video. Sometimes the sound get's so overused, so repetitive, I genuinely find myself wanting to delete the app. If I could block audios, I would enjoy using what used to be my favorite app, again.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I do enjoy Tiktok, the communities I've found on there are a ton of fun, but I don't like how updated are rolled out. They'll roll out a feature that quickly becomes popular, like photo mode or the new voice changers, then leave users who didn't get it initially hanging. I want to join in on trends that simply aren't available to me because of some arbitrary choice. It's an unfair system which doesn't promote growth equally. There seems to be an Apple priority too, which further proves my point.

I have no warnings or strikes on my account. It's become extremely aggravating for me to use now because it's switching back and forth from being out of date..

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

An easy solution is to allow users to manually adjust their own audio/video delay during drafting by adding a small audio control widget such as ---> Audio [-1 frame | +1 frame].

It's on the far right. 3. Make sure it's an MP3 file. It'll only work that way. (note: sometimes, it'll only allow you to film for 15 seconds.)

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Don't believe the news!!! You can absolutely control what this App does and doesn't have access to on your phone. They don't have to have your precise location or access to your contacts and such to work effectively. You can view vids and post vids without giving this app all the premssions it requests. The permissions it asks for is to give you a better (more streamlined) experience. If you choose to grant the app permissions you can change that at any time within the settings.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The first few minutes of this app are fun. As the algorithm gets more accustomed to what you like. But from there, it's a way to spiral. I used to have to physically pry my phone away so I wasn't sucked into more videos. It's a dangerous app which can waste your time. I know it isn't a fault of the app necessarily, but the fact that short based content has even taken over YouTube is a little bit scary. I just hate the format.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm a regular content creator with a decent following. I love making videos, but lately I've had a technical issue with the app. Everytime I record audio there's a cracking/static noise at the end of the clip. Then even when I try to cut out the cracking noise at the end of the clip when I add a sound for the background, it starts to distort the audio at random times. It makes recording and editing videos frustrating when this app issue compromises the quality of your video content.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I really enjoy this app, a lot. But when I put my videos into their folders/playlisy thing and the video is removed or taken down by the creator, it leaves a grey picture saying the video has been removed, and it stays there, and it won't let me click more than one to take them out of my folder. Instead it makes me click each on individually to delete it then makes me go all the way back to delete the other ones. Which is annoying.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Please just request a quick question.I was trying to edit a video and I found out that there is no option to change text to speech only audio. A l've made sure the app is up to date so I don't know why it's not working. Oh and it would also be nice if everyone had the same editing features. Allowing them on one phone but not other gets really annoying. I am only talking about TikTok editing which other apps can't find to edit clips. My account @aftab.mahar786

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This is the highest I can rate tiktok right now. Why? Because of the amount of lag whenever u create a video. For example: I just got out of Twitter (X) and I went to tiktok and create a video about it. Tiktok literally closes the app completely till my screen is fully black. Or sometimes if that doesn't happen, it lags so badly that u can barely use the app. Even when u repost videos it doesn't show all the videos you've reposted. No matter how much you've reopened the app doesn't work.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I give it two stars. One for the effects like reality ripple and one for the ai effect. But, It has problems... I tried using the studio feature to make a short video, first I spent hours learning how to edit, add effects, then it froze up. I lost all my work. Gave it another chance, spent so much time on adding effects to my minute long clip, and went to save it as a draft, it went to video limbo. NEVER SAVED IT!!! Boo hiss!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I seem to have a lot of lagging. It pops up and says i have no internet... even though i do! No matter if its on 5G or wifi. I find this to be uber annoying. And im tired of seeing ads! And i wish it actually listened when i clicked "not interested" It bugs when the same junk keeps popping up. Id also like it if after 2 plays to the video it automatically scrolls to the next one or at least pauses and doesnt continue to play the same thing after a couple watches. Aside from this, its a fun app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Audio doubles when you go to upload a video and the app doesn't sync properly. I don't get notifications for all comments, i don't get notifications for most likes. On desktop there's a different number of followers and likes than mobile. The desktop version syncs better, but even so...you can't upload on desktop anymore. There's always a problem when it comes to being a creator.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This is a great app where you can express yourself & have fun!! However, there's 2 problems I've had recently. When I make a video w/ multiple clips, it looks normal & fine when I'm editing it but once it's posted, I see that it lags rlly badly. So the video goes good for the first few seconds then it freezes & when the sound ends, the clips start to show up but instead, they are sped up. Plz fix this issue. I've had it happen w/ 3 tiktoks already:/ That rlly upsets me:(

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a really good app, but with some odd limitations, which kind of need to be fixed. 1: You cant trim your videos, sure there's a timer, but there's almost no way you can count out the exact amount of seconds you're going to need, it would be easier with trim. 2: If you see a video that says, "duetthis" you can't see if anyone has duetted it, and you cant search for a specific video, only hashtags. 3: you can't see when a video was posted.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Personally, I think this app is great. The algorithm figures out what you like and dislike so you end up with videos that will interest you. You can use the app for just entertainment purposes or you can create content and make a lifestyle out of the app. There are different sides of tiktok from books, cooking, dance, football and much more! There are some downfalls to the app including the fact that you may end up looking track of time. Overall really recommend the app.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's good app to use and I'm having great experience using it, but tiktok putting my videos on "this video is not eligible for foryou page" I'm a digital creator and been making videos for every platform using copyright free content from certain websites and there is nothing wrong with it in any other social media platforms but I'm having this issue that tiktok algorithm thinks that I'm not using original footages and videos please sort this out . thank you.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

Over all I prefer it more than other social media apps.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I think its one of the best apps in terms of entertainment, but its got two flaws that are driving me crazy: 1. The ads are completely irrelevant to me. For example, I was getting makeup ads for like 3 weeks straight. No idea why since I don't follow any beauty brands or creators. 2. Everytime I close it, I get a message from my phone saying "Tik Tok is draining your battery", so I have to Force Close it. This seems shady (why is it still running?) & drains my battery.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Overall good app, but it would be better if iphones and Androids didn't have different features.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I'm unsure if this is because of particular colors or what, but it's worth keeping note of. Right now they are a faint red that I can only see on light colors but yeah.. sucks.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

I am now single because of Tik Tok.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Beware Burn-in! This is an app with overall highly enjoyable and addictive content. It is very easy to spend hours watching video after video, but this can and will lead to screen burn-in that is often not covered by your device warranty. TikTok, you lost two stars for not allowing the option to hide the icons at the bottom and right of the screen.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Cons: - App UI was a bit hard to understand at first - Responding to a specific message in the chat automatically jumps to the end of the conversation so I have to scroll back up after each response that I make which is unnecessary and obstructive. - Videos can be saved in only one collection at a time. - I get alerts for old videos of followed accounts Pros: - The FYP is surprisingly close to my interests most of the time which is very satisfying. - Doesn't take long to get used to the UI.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Tik Tok is a great social media app. But one thing that they need to quickly change is having certain effects not being available on Android devices. For example, the green screen effect is not available but that is one of the most used effects on there for trends and video creation in general. It is not fair that people do not have a chance to use the app at its full potential.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: App features are inaccessible. For several months after the new voice filters came out I didn't have them. I've already tried updating, making sure my phone is updated, etc.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

If you value your personal information and data (which you should) please uninstall.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I really like tiktok. There's so much content variety, you're seeing what the world wants to share, if you think it's fake you can look it up on your own to be sure. Also it's every emotion you could want, some sad, inspirational, hilarity, news, cool things. The only thing it's missing is back and forth audio/video interaction. Like the -Live broadcasts are cool, but the person doing it can't really do anything except try to read what people are typing, so for now it gets 4 stars.

Other than that, it would be 5 stars.
